Photons

photon.Rd

Various functionality to deal with the 4-momentum of a photon

Usage

is.consistent.nullvec(N,TOL=1e-10)
as.photon(x,E=1)

Arguments

N

Four-momentum to be tested for nullness

TOL

tolerance

x

Vector of three-velocities

E

Energy, a scalar

Details

Returns the four-momentum of a photon.

Author

Robin K. S. Hankin

See also

4mom,reflect

Examples


## A bunch of photons all approximately parallel to the x-axis:
as.photon(as.3vel(cbind(0.9,runif(10)/1000,runif(10)/1000)))
#>       E       p_x          p_y          p_z
#>  [1,] 1 0.9999999 0.0003863202 8.289684e-05
#>  [2,] 1 0.9999996 0.0008285481 2.872443e-04
#>  [3,] 1 0.9999994 0.0003012476 1.056352e-03
#>  [4,] 1 0.9999993 0.0005672611 1.066512e-03
#>  [5,] 1 0.9999994 0.0004427322 1.031774e-03
#>  [6,] 1 0.9999997 0.0005704816 5.291353e-04
#>  [7,] 1 0.9999993 0.0005443839 1.068349e-03
#>  [8,] 1 0.9999990 0.0008497694 1.098578e-03
#>  [9,] 1 0.9999998 0.0005215258 2.636803e-04
#> [10,] 1 0.9999997 0.0001285479 8.137680e-04


## mirror ball:
jj <- matrix(rnorm(30),10,3)
disco <- sweep(matrix(rnorm(30),10,3),1,sqrt(rowSums(jj^2)),`/`)
p <- as.photon(c(1,0,0))
reflect(p,disco)
#>   E        p_x         p_y         p_z
#> x 1  0.8669779 -0.45255661  0.20866661
#> x 1  0.7698712  0.02953766  0.63751535
#> x 1  0.6369720  0.59908722 -0.48514038
#> x 1  0.8358205 -0.38213204 -0.39418170
#> x 1 -0.8653192  0.12204257 -0.48613616
#> x 1  0.4811257  0.29967540 -0.82384025
#> x 1  0.4109840  0.12769301  0.90265531
#> x 1  0.6331221 -0.54163376 -0.55298211
#> x 1  0.6226004 -0.77895819  0.07478531
#> x 1 -0.9551178  0.10737985 -0.27607891

table(reflect(p,disco)[,2]>0) # should be TRUE with probability sqrt(0.5)
#> 
#> FALSE  TRUE 
#>     2     8 

## relativistic  disco; mirror ball moves at 0.5c:

B <- boost(as.3vel(c(0.5,0,0)))
p |> tcrossprod(B) |> reflect(disco) |> tcrossprod(solve(B))
#>           t          x           y           z
#> x 0.9556593  0.9113186 -0.26128368  0.12047372
